description: Article 1.1: The applicant must clearly state which licensing category they are applying for (PSP or P2P Marketplace Lending).
Article 1.2: Payment Service Providers require minimum paid-up capital of QAR 5,000,000. P2P Lending platforms require QAR 7,500,000.
Article 2.1: CVs and police clearance certificates must be submitted for all Board Members, CEO, and the designated Compliance Officer.
Article 2.2: The entity must be registered in the State of Qatar. Final Articles of Association are required.
Article 3.1: All customer PII and transaction data must be stored on servers physically located within the State of Qatar.
Article 4.1: Must include a board-approved AML/CFT policy with robust procedures.
Article 4.1: A qualified, dedicated Compliance Officer must be appointed.
Article 4.1: Comprehensive CDD and Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) procedures must be documented and implemented.
Article 4.1: A robust, real-time transaction monitoring system for detecting suspicious activities is required.
Article 4.1: Clear procedures and systems for filing Suspicious Activity Reports with QFIU must be established.

requirement: Comprehensive BCP and Tested DR Plan
description: Article 5.1: A comprehensive Business Continuity Plan (BCP) and a fully tested Disaster Recovery (DR) plan with defined RTO/RPO are mandatory.
